chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Fernando Garcia Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay costs 
*  If extended supervison is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Pay all Court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge; work on making payments throughout supervision
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess or consume controlled substance without a valid prescription

*No contact with the victim or the victim's family, or their residence or place of employment 
*No contact with minors without prior agent approval
*Complete sex offender assessment and comply with conditions
*Comply with sex offender registry
*Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervison regarding alcohol and drugs 
*Comply with other assessments, treatment and programming as deemed apprpriate by the Compass assessment and the Department of Corrections 
*Sign release of information form's for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment 
*Provide DNA sample if not already completed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Fernando Garcia in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Fernando Garcia in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:41 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Constable has no additions, deletions or corrections.
Atty Schmidt has a number of amendments to the PSI report and states these on the record; Court has noted the amendments.
Atty Constable indicates that the probation officer has just provided her with an addendum to the PSI dated 01/22/16, but no parties have received a copy.  Copies are being made and the parties will be allowed to review prior to proceeding with the sentencing.
Court has received the victim impact statement.
Atty Schmidt has read and reviewed the addendum with his client and makes a statement.
State has complied with victim notification and the victim's mother appears in Court; Court indicates the receipt of the victim impact statement.
Victim makes an additional statment to the information already provided in her victim impact statement.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.
9:41 a.m.  Atty Schmidt makes additional statements regarding the sentencing 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Sentenced to Prison for 20 years with 10 years of initial confinement and 10 years of extended supervision
Consecutive to any other sentence that the defendant is currently serving

***Conditions of Extended Supervision:
*No contact with the victim or the victim's family, or their residence or place of employment
*No contact with minors without prior agent approval
*Complete sex offender assessment and comply with conditions
*Comply with sex offender registry
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
*Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision regarding alcohol or drugs
*Do not possess or consume controlled substance without a valid prescription 
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Comply with other assessments, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass assessment and the Department of Corrections
*Sign release of information form's for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment 
*Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge; work on making payments throughout supervision
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
*Provide DNA sample if not already completed 
*Pay court costs including DNA surcharge - paid from 25% of prison account

20 days to appeal 

Count 2 - DRI
and Writ of Habeas Corpus

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 01-22-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Fernando Garcia in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Fernando Garcia in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
2:51 p.m.  Court calls the case.  

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Moves to dismiss the repeater enhancer on Count 1. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
BY THE COURT:  Court grants the motion to remove the repeater enhancer. 

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 (amended) - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1 (w/o the repeater).  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders a PSI.  
PSI to be completed one week prior to sentencing and copies given to the parties. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing at 10-27-2015 02:30 pm

Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The defendant does not appear.  

Atty Constable indicates the defendant was not ordered to be transported from the prison system.  
Atty Schmidt is prepared to proceed on most of the motions without the defendant present.  Inappropriate to proceed on the Other Acts motion without the defendant present. 
Neither party will be providing evidence. 

State's Motions in Limine - 
#1 - Stipulated to by parties.  Court will not make a specific order. 
#2 & #3 - Stipulated to by the parties. 
#4 - State and Defense stipulate that if the defendant testifies at the trial in his own defense, he can be asked if he has been convicted and will answer yes, how many he must answer 10. 
Court questions the parties. 
Oldest 4 convictions.  
BY THE COURT:  Court grants #4 as stipulated to the 10 convictions. 

Defendant's Motions in Limine (filed 10/9) -
#1 & #2 - Should be taken up with the State's motion for Other Acts at a later date. 
#3 - Atty Schmidt withdraws. 
#4 - Stipulated to by the parties.  BY THE COURT:  Granted. 
#5 - Stipulated to by the parties.  BY THE COURT:  Both parties are under sequestration order under 906.15  Court will allow the witnesses to gather but not allowed to discuss the case.  

Atty Constable makes statements re: transport of the defendant from prison.

BY THE COURT:  Court asks that if the defendant cannot be transported here,  the parties are to try to arrange for the defendant to appear via video-conferencing.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
